website_summaries.verdict: Available in an impressive six sizes including 512GB, the storage options and 4K video capture ability make this a good buy from a trusted brand.
pros: With storage capacities up to 512GB, this model offers flexibility to users to find exactly the amount of storage they need
Fast write speed allows this card to easily capture 4K video resolution
90MB per second read speed is adequate for most users
This model is compatible with virtually all modern cameras and smartphones
cons: This model may not meet the needs of users who need to transfer a lot of data quickly, as its transfer speeds are slightly slower than some cards

customer_reviews.title: KINGSTON Means Quality and Reliability.
customer_reviews.text: Here are the "good" and "bad" on this product. . . ADVANTAGES . 1. QUALITY: In the past, Kingston brand computer memory chips are known for having the highest quality and reliability. The manufacturer's venture into microSDHC memory products continues it's stellar legacy. . 2. PRICE: This product is the lowest price for brand names - $1 below SanDisk. . . DISADVANTAGES . 1. There are none. From experience, I have never experienced a defective Kingston brand product. In fact, my 2008 purchased memory chips and 2011 purchased microSD reader are still being used.
customer_reviews.author: Gene P. Louie

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a SDHC Card. It is a SDXC Card. But, read on....
customer_reviews.text: The description says SDHC. The picture of the product says SDXC. If you need this for a security camera type operation, it probably won't work as it's formatted in exFAT, and Windows will not let you change that. However, download EaseUS Partition Master, for free, and then you can format the card so it will work. Must use FAT32 file structure for the format. Once that's completed, it should work in your camera, etc. Again, Windows will not let you format it to FAT32. Use EaseUS Partition Master. Again, it might work.
customer_reviews.author: Yendor

customer_reviews.title: Card broke after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Used this in my new game camera, it worked for the first week then we put it back out for about a month. When we retrieved it the card was unreadable and unable to be formatted. I do not reccomend this product. I tried using it several devices and it failed in all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Roku and cheaper than buying direct
customer_reviews.text: Purchased specifically for my Roku's and they worked perfectly. Roku sells MicroSD cards directly (generic 2gb), but with shipping, these faster 16gb cards were actually cheaper overall. I have 2 Roku 3's, and 1 Roku Premiere+ and I turned off each unit, inserted the card, then when I turned them each on I was asked to format the MicroSD card. That process took about 5-7 minutes and now that minor annoyance of refreshing channels is gone for good! :) And since these cards have more capacity (that Roku won't use), they may be more useful down the road for other applications too.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Riddel

customer_reviews.title: It's ok... Will not purchase again though.
customer_reviews.text: Upon 1st inspection it looks nice. It functioned well and had no real lag time on my camera. The card lost 2600 pics after the 1st shoot though.. I was rather upset as I had barely reviewed them. I managed to get a few loaded to my portable drive but now the rest are gone.. Seems to function fine now... Will not take a chance it when taking important pictures again. It will serve out life in a cheap deer camera in the middle of a forest.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Goose

customer_reviews.title: Reliable But Slow
customer_reviews.text: Card works as expected, but seems a little slow compared to my other 32gb SDHC cards.
customer_reviews.author: HML

customer_reviews.title: Good price for the capacity
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to add extra space to a laptop/netbook with onlya 32gb eMMC. System immediately recognized it and doubled my storage. Seems to work fast and efficiently- as efficiently as the under-powered netbook allows anyway. Good price for the capacity..
customer_reviews.author: Linda C., Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: I've got this for my New 3DS XL to put my games on. What I found important to search for was a legitimate SD card that gave the real space it was advertising. There is a common occurrence of illegitimate SD cards that are tampered to show 16-128GB space storages, but in reality have 2-4gb. I went searching for reviews that gave the impression of a legitimate product. I am happy to confirm that the reviews hold up. Kingston has done well in shipping legitimate SD cards.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Cook

customer_reviews.title: Used a few weeks, works great.
customer_reviews.text: The packaging I hate: hard to open, and once ripped open cannot be reused to store the micro SD card. Other than that, the "Kingston Canvas Select 32GB microSDHC" is an excellent product. Installed it in a dash cam, been recording 720p+VGA simultaneously (2 cameras), recordings are smooth and show no problems (hiccups, drop-outs, freezing) in the saved video files. Card has been in a car parked outdoors most of the day, exposure to heat from sunlight has not caused any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mochi ball

customer_reviews.title: Was not recognized by my computer after the first use.
customer_reviews.text: I put it in the computer slot and it was recognized showing 466GB. I took it out and put it back in again and it was never recognized anymore. Didn't look like a fake one so I am not sure why, probably defective by manufacture or an occasional glinch.
customer_reviews.author: Bahman

customer_reviews.title: used 3 times and memory is now smaller
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these. I use one as my main card and clone it to the other card. Did this twice and now the backup does no longer fit on on the second card. Looked for bad sectors but could not find any. Used a variety of utilities to look at card, reformatted, all kinds of stuff, but space never came back. Can't trust these cards anymore. Never encountered this problem with my my 6 Sandisk cards or my 10 Patriot cards. Luckily I image also to hard drive. Very disappointed. Kingston used to be a good name.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S.

customer_reviews.title: Using with Nintendo Switch.
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased the 128gb for $13 for my Nintendo Switch. I was originally using a 64gb SanDisk which worked perfectly, however, 64gb just wasn't cutting it anymore & it was time to get more space. I'm getting 116gb rather than 128gb, that's still pretty good though so I'm not complaining. I've been using this SD card for two months now in my Switch with zero issues. If I need any more SD cards I'll come back to SanDisk or Kingston since they've both been reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany M. S.

customer_reviews.title: does not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use for a vehicle camera and it doesn’t format properly for the camera... then doesn’t work at all after trying to use it for a tablet It’s a piece of junk and waste of money. Would give 0 stars if I could, and found out too late to return
customer_reviews.author: jc120

customer_reviews.title: Work great so far
customer_reviews.text: Am using this in my dash cam. 2nd card I have bought for dash cam use. First one is over 2 years with constant 1080 p 60 recordings on it with no problems at all. 32 gig is a good size for my needs, keeps a few weeks worth of driving on it. I tend to reformat them every 2 months or so.
customer_reviews.author: Nalon1

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for Rexing dash cam
customer_reviews.text: Despite this specific brand and model being the recommended MicroSD card by Rexing for their dash cams, it could not keep up and would cause the dash cam recordings to freeze after just a few seconds. I wound up buying a different brand card at half the price of this one and it works fine. I wasted $43 plus a $15 one-time-use Amazon coupon on two of these cards and I'm not really happy about that. I would not recommend these cards for any kind of high-intensity video recording such as a dash cam.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin N.

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: used this for a pi kodi box, thing failed. samsung one I found lying around got me up and running smoothly
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dortch

customer_reviews.title: Load Wait Times Eliminated
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Roku 3 and now I don't have to wait for the hated load times. Love it. No programming required. Inserted it and it worked right away.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for $5. Speed is as fast as advertised. Made in Taiwan and it's not counterfeit so that's always great. Haven't used it long enough so I'm not sure how durable it is, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Canadian Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Solid brand and a great price
customer_reviews.text: Whats not to like? I only needed a standard speed card so getting 32GB for under 12 bucks is just what i was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Rindahl

customer_reviews.title: No exagerration - I use them in raspberry pi zeros and I've bought at least 50
customer_reviews.text: I have never gotten a Kingston SD card that did not work and work well. I've never had one quit after working a bit. Kingston SD cards are quality and they last. You might think, at the price these are being offered at, that there is something wrong with them or they're B stock. Not so. They come in retail packaging and are exactly what you'd get if you went to the local store, but at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Staggs

customer_reviews.title: Fast. Inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the Kingston Canvas Select SDHC Class 10 UHS-1 SD Memory Card in both my DSLR camera and for external storage on my Chromebook. It works well in both. It's very fast and one of the least expensive SD Cards in its Class. I haven't had any issues with performance or reliability. I can't ask for anything more.
customer_reviews.author: DLH

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 7 months in a dash cam
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card so that my new dash cam could record for days without overwriting the previous recordings. After taking a friend for a ride, I wanted to show him the quality of the recording. I popped out the card and it could not be read by any of three computers that had at one time read the card. The camera acts like it can tell that a card is in it, but it can't read it or even format it. It lasted seven months. I'll try a different brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: Mustang

customer_reviews.title: It has write speed problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dash cam. Once the card started to fill up, the write speed dropped. It dropped so low that the recording stopped. I sent it back to Kingston thinking the card was bad. The new card had the same problem. Got another replacement. Same thing! I contacted Kingston engineering and sent them my card and had them do their own testing. They got the same results as I did and refunded me the cost of the card because they didn't have any alternative card to send me that didn't have the same problem. I don't see how they can continue to sell a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: IcePlanet

customer_reviews.title: It's storage
customer_reviews.text: Price was good. Reason for only 3 stars was the loose fit in the adapter. Does not "click" in place. Doesn't fit very snug at all. If it wasn't going into a stationary device, i would have returned for this reason. Not sure if it was just my card, but the actual storage was many GB less than the 64GB listed. I know that cards "reserve" a section, but never more than a gig or 2. This one was closer to 5GB. And, yes, it was after formatting. Still plenty of storage for the what I need. Once again, for the price this was a good deal, even with the issues I have listed. Not great, but definitely good.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Walton

customer_reviews.title: They fit, they work, and they're totally forgettable. And that's good.
customer_reviews.text: If you're expecting an insightful and entertaining review; don't. These are fairly high-quality, high-speed mass storage, used in a dash cam, that: 1. Fit properly. 2. Format both in a desktop computer and the device. 3. Operate at or about the stated speed and offer the stated storage capacity. 4. Are competitively priced. 5 . Don't include unnecessary, unwanted and potentially harmful programs that hog storage space and cannot REALLY be removed. So, they'll do what you expect them to do for a long time without any drama.
customer_reviews.author: tartantyger

customer_reviews.title: Kingston customer service won't honor their warranty
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working within 3 months. Tried to file a warranty claim. They made me wait an hour on the phone. Finally got a rep who said he will assist. Received email from kingston and filled out the forms. After that, no further responses.... It is almost a scam as they don't think people will file a warranty claim for such an inexpensive item. Amazon also dropped the ball ob this one as they said i had to contact the manufacturer even though it is under the warranty. Lesson learned: don't buy SD cards from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Go with a name brand don't waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: I highly don't recommend. As soon as I inserted it into my phone my photos disappeared I didn't approve the sd card to store my photos on it but it automatically did and when I went to photos I couldn't view them they said they was on the sd card I go to SD card photos aren't there. I then was no longer able to screenshot or save photos from other apps. I transferred my apps to the SD card and then it would be times the SD card would say it's not inserted and it would be. And then apparently the sd card installed twice on my phone which the pictures is on one but it's not reading it.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Kingston Canvas Select 32GB microSDHC Class 10 microSD Memory Card UHS-I 80MB/s R Flash Memory Card for only around $5.95 each! Great price for the size and speed. Put them in our new cell phones and they worked great. Much better experience than the $12 16GB Lexar microSDHC card that ended up with uncorrectable errors in the first few days.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: Isn't Linux-friendly
customer_reviews.text: This card is unusable with the current version of Linux I'm using (a recent version of Debian). With the exact same computer and card reader, a Samsung 64 GB card works fine. The card works fine with Windows (not surprisingly...). Thus, if you're simply interested in using it on a Windows machine, it's safe to disregard this review. Otherwise, I'd think twice before purchasing this card.
customer_reviews.author: D Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Got it on sale
customer_reviews.text: Storage Day sale and got it for I think $18. Been needing another one to take movies and tv shows with me on the road. I have had it for 2 weeks or so. Has worked perfectly. Some reviews claim issues so I will update if it crashes. In the meantime nothing critically important on it, just media. Works great with the iPad play plug. Great to watch any type of file without Apple's lame restrictions or using iTunes.
customer_reviews.author: Marcadimus

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Fast cards! They work great with my GoPro session and my FPV goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: You must have the capability to reformat to fat32 if you want that.  Wrong description.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good card but was different than what it was sold as. It was sold in the description as a SDHC but it is actually a SDXC. Thats a problem if you need the SDHC as our new car needed for the cameras. It needed the SDHC fat32 capability. Im glad that I was able to reformat it to fat 32. I couldnt do it on my regular pc since they dont give the option to do it from the regular screen. I ended up having to download a software that could do it. Now it works great. So alittle hassle but works fine now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Severns

customer_reviews.title: Died first time we used it.
customer_reviews.text: We went on a 4,000 mile road trip and bought this card to go in our new Rexing dash cam as it was recommended by Rexing. What a mistake. The card malfunctioned and we missed out on capturing some beautiful scenery in the Big Bend area of Texas. More importantly we were almost run off the road by a semi. NONE of this footage was on the card. In almost 12 hours of driving it recorded less than 4 minutes. Not the dash cams fault either. We bought a cheap Sandisk card at Walmart and it worked perfectly the rest of our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Hofy

customer_reviews.title: Never experienced Data Rot with Kingston.
customer_reviews.text: since 2007 I have purchased a variety of Kingston Products ranging from Memory card to Flash drives and Ram. I have never experienced issues (other than 1 ID:10T error on my part). Last month my sister in law was involved in a hit and run and so I decided it time to purchase a dash cam. I went with the Rexing v1p 3rd gen due to the amount of positive reviews. In the description they recommended The Kingston Canvas Go card, and without hesitation I knew it was going to be a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Clark

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and used less than a month in a game camera. Retrieved card and it will not even be recognized by computer. Can not even reformat it. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: mkhunt

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months and won't reformat
customer_reviews.text: This worked great in our Rexing V1 Pro dash cam for two months but now it keeps saying that it needs to be reformatted, which we have tried to do a number of times but the issue remains and our firmware is up to date. Rexing recommends this particular card so we are going to try another one (maybe got a lemon) but what good is a memory card that doesn't work in a dash cam when you might need it. We didn't keep the package but will for the next order so we can hopefully return it if it dies like the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Fawn

customer_reviews.title: Android sd card as internal storage compatible.
customer_reviews.text: I was mostly looking for an sd card that could activate my phone's "sd card as internal storage feature." The evo select I had didn't do it since it was too slow, but this one hit the mark with no issues. If this is what you are looking for, take my review as confirmation. Besides this, it works like every other sd card, but based on online professional reviews, this sd card was specifically optimized for smartphones, which to me is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: cristobal rendon

customer_reviews.title: Memory size and price is right. Using on a loop recording devices
customer_reviews.text: This brand is very good and i do trusted for years, for some devices that i have i can past 32 gb, so this fit perfect and the price was right. I used on some mini security cam and car dashboard camera, not issue at all and this cameras has a loop recording so what the means is constantly recording, erasing and recording again constantly, so issues at all and i can take to my computer with the adapter and check those videos on a computer. I do recommend for any device that can go past 32 gb of storage capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Terranova

customer_reviews.title: Dead after one week of use in Raspberry Pi
customer_reviews.text: Ordered in April, dead by July. Powered-on the Pi after being shut down for 3 months. Getting "segmentation fault" for shutdown and reboot commands. Tried to image the card, but only got 11.9 GB of data recovered (and very, very slowly, at that). Not worth the effort of RMA'ing the thing (but I think that they count on that mentality). Oh well, they win the battle but, bad quality will eventually lose them the war.
customer_reviews.author: hilndr44

customer_reviews.title: Can’t return my defective product bought from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This micro SD card Kingston 128GB was working at first, but then it went blank right after I threw away its wrapper. Now I cannot returned it. I got burned, and feeling that this is straight FRAUD from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy H. Quang

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I use these mini SD cards in dash cams and found them to be very reliable. I have never had any issues with the smaller format SD cards despite my misgivings after having two standard SD cards just stop working and would not re-format. Not so with these. And given the hot in-car dash cam environment, reliablity is critical. A dashcam with a dead SD card is of no use. Have had two of these in dashcams for over a year with NO issues. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Mallon

customer_reviews.title: 16GB microSDHC Class 10 microSD Memory Card for ROKU
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these to install in a ROKU Ultra and three ROKU 3s. They each came in genuine Kingston clam shell packaging. They all formatted without any problem. These are probably much larger than the ROKU needs but they are class 10 and they work. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: OK for the Price
customer_reviews.text: 1st off let me start by saying you'll most likely have to disable your antivirus to download on the PC as it is flagged as a threat. The software for the computer could be disigned a little better or easier to use but it works. On the app for the phone, Manual panning is slow and not very accurate. Picture quality of the camera is slightly grainy but again it's not a high end camera. On the plus side, I had 2 Dericam Cameras (one replaced the other then both failed) This one I've had for over a month and seems to hold up. And it came with an outdoor spkr/mic module that I have not tried yet.
customer_reviews.author: D. McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Micro SD Card.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it used from Amazon Warehouse Deals and even though it came in a small envelope, I was just hoping it worked. It was clean, had all original markings, and looked like it was new just repackaged. I'm using this card in a raspberry pi and it is performing perfectly. I cannot be more pleased! Thank You! I would highly recommend Amazon Warehouse Deals...mostly if you want to save some money. And I would recommend this card for your storage needs.
customer_reviews.author: Warren K.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable And Trustworthy Video Card
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these for use in Rexing DashCams. The 128 GB capacity allows me to record over 12 hours of 1080P quality video. They have performed perfectly with no lost frames or stuttering of video. This is absolutely essential if you are involved in an automobile wreck. Having reliable video evidence is essential in winning a legal case. I think this card delivers reliable trustworthy service.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: "ALWAYS HAVE A SPARE" , IS MY BEST ADVISE  , SAVE MONEY , THESE SD CARDS SAVE YOU $$$HUGE$$$..!!
customer_reviews.text: PAYING LESS THAN $5 (WHEN ON SALE) FOR THIS $29.95 MSRP ITEM IS NOT TO BE OVER LOOKED NOR IGNORED , I HAVE 4 BLANK ONES READY TO STORE MY MOST PRSONAL FILES AND DATA ON A RELIABLE "KINGSTON" (MY FAVORITE BRAND) MICRO SDCARD , WHEN MY PRESENT ONE RUNS OUT F ROOM..!! SHAME ON APPLE IPHONES THAT DO NOT TAKE AN "SD CARD" BOTH MY FRIENDS THAT OWN APPLES , SAY THIER PHONE IS ALWAYS "CONSTIPATED" (LOL) BECAUSE THEY ALWAYS RUN OUT OF STORAGE SPACE A FEW DAYS BEFORE THE SCHEDULED CLAUD (TRUST CLAUDS ??👎) UP LOAD..!!
customer_reviews.author: COLEMAN S.M.

customer_reviews.title: Card OK, But No Case Included
customer_reviews.text: The card seems to be fine, but it does not come with a standard plastic case. Instead, the card is presented in a blister pack, which I suppose could be used to store the card, but (a) it is very flimsy, and (b) it is considerably larger than standard SD card cases. Given the good price on this product, there's not a lot of room to complain, but including a standard case would not have bumped the price up very much.
customer_reviews.author: BluegrassPicker

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long and stopped working properly
customer_reviews.text: While this was affordable, this card didn’t last very long. I popped this into my dash cam as they recommended a Class 10 card for its HD recording and write speed since a dashcam loops recording. After about a year, it no longer supported loop recording and had to be manually formatted to support new footage. It may have longer life performing other tasks, but it didn’t last long for me
customer_reviews.author: J Ali

customer_reviews.title: Not 32GB, not even 32 billion bytes, only 28.9 GB
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to not getting the stated capacity for memory devices. A 32GB device is rarely 32 Gigabytes (34,359,738,368 bytes). But most of the time you get at least 32 billion bytes (32,000,000,000). This device natively formats at 28.9 GB, equivalent to 31,092,375,552 bytes. It is pretty fast. It writes at an actual sustained speed of 31.1 MB/second.
customer_reviews.author: Dan G.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work,  always says FULL
customer_reviews.text: I tried this card in three different cameras and it doesn't work in any of them. It always reads as FULL even though there is no data on the card. I tried formatting on a pc and in the cameras but still says FULL. Booooo!
customer_reviews.author: It's Only Me

customer_reviews.title: Does its job, where Samsung cards could not...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use in a set of Samsung SmartCams when the cards I purchased previously failed to perform. The Samsung cards, Samsung PRO Endurance 32GB Micro SDHC Card with Adapter - 100MB/s U1 (MB-MJ32GA/AM), skipped on playback every time sound was a part of the recording. The Kingston cards have no issues and record and playback the SmartCam video flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Gal

customer_reviews.title: Finally...the perfect choice
customer_reviews.text: If you are using this for a camera, don't buy bigger than 32GB. Most cameras struggle with a bigger card. Lesson one, well learned. Lesson two, there's a reason the cheap chips are cheap. Look for a good brand, keep it at 32GB or less and you'll see a world of difference. I'm writing this review to let you know Kingston is the perfect choice. The price is certainly not the cheapest. But it's decent and the quality is noticeably better. If you are just storing files, buy a cheap chip. But if you are looking for pictures or video, you'll be happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky A.

customer_reviews.title: MAX QUALITY, REPUTATION, SPEED, COST/VALUE RATIO!
customer_reviews.text: Kingston is premium! Yet the price is extremely cost-effective, for what you get. My daughter needed it URGENTLY for her highschool photography course, but she had a school provided high-end camera that took orig SD cards, w her own iPhone & Mac Pro laptop using microSD.
customer_reviews.author: Solaris Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great microSD at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Kingston MicroSD cards are in my opinion one of the best memory cards out in the market. I have used them for years and they have never failed me. I recently purchased a pair for my vehicle dashcam. This 80MB/s R Flash Memory Card sends and receives data at a superb rate. The one thing I like most about it is the warranty, if it ever goes bad just call them up, however in over 15 years I have never had one go bad even after it had water damage.
customer_reviews.author: nmateo

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Put this my 8GB Sandisk Clip Jam and Now I have much more storage
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my 8GB Sandisk Clip Jam and this Kingston micro SD card syncs up great with it. I am quite surprised how well. When this micro SD is inserted, the Clip Jam software automatically creates a new separate flash drive with its own sections for music, books, audible, podcasts. THUS I now have 16 more gigabytes that are formatted the same as the original 8GB the Clip Jam comes with
customer_reviews.author: a realist

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an SD card for my picky 3D printer!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as intended. My 3D printer is picky about SD cards. The unofficial wiki listed this as a useable option. Can confirm - this works with the Monoprice Mini Delta! Just keep the FAT32 formatting. Keep the same blocksize if you ever reformat, and the printer will work great. Beyond that? What can I say - its an SD card. Size in base-1000KB is as advertized, same as any other storage medium
customer_reviews.author: ZazzMan

customer_reviews.title: Sealed package, used card
customer_reviews.text: Resold the card, it had sat on the shelf for 5 months, never broke the package open. Customer just messaged me to let me know there were "selfies" on the card of a woman tying herself up on a bed. Considering it was a sealed package, this can only mean they are repackaging used cards or someone at the plant thought they'd be funny. Either way, I won't be purchasing any more Kingston products.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price, and many reasons to use them
customer_reviews.text: I picked this for Price and Capacity for some of my hobbies. I used as storage for data logger for my data logger shield for my Arduino Uno boards, I have used them or the Micro SD card that comes with the SD adapter for Security Cameras and this size can be good as a lower capacity option that is offered now at good prices. As for many of my hobby needs I do not need any capacity too large currently so this has worked out very well for my hobbies.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the Monoprice MP Mini Delta 3D Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it is one of the few SD Cards that works with the Monoprice MiniDelta 3D printer. And it works straight out of the box. No formatting required, put your files on it, put it in the printer, and the printer can see the contents. Make sure it is the Kingston Canvas Select 16GB microSDHC Class 10 microSD Memory Card.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the Rexing Dash cam
customer_reviews.text: Formatted easily in my new Rexing dash cam. I have used my dash cam for 3 days and each time I downloaded it to my laptop, it worked perfectly. Be careful when you eject it because it will go flying due to its light weight. This is my first time with such a large capacity memory card and I was surprised how reasonable the price was. I have ordered a 2nd card.
customer_reviews.author: TXk

customer_reviews.title: Well made SD cards
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for a couple of months in 3 different cameras so far, shooting up to 4k60fps and 24mp pictures. They have been flawless in recording and transfer to the computer.
customer_reviews.author: JWSloan

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with security cameras and I knew very little about what I needed to buy before stumbling onto this page. I love that they lay it out for us laypeople on what features to look for if we're buying a memory card for a camera and that they provide a clear distinction in their product list. I have since used it with several camera and am quite pleased with the results, both in terms of quality of pictures and videos, and storage capacity.
customer_reviews.author: XS

customer_reviews.title: Great for Raspberry Pi or other SBC
customer_reviews.text: These only last a year or two before they fail. Fortunately, they always fail in such a way that you can no longer write but they're still readable. When that happens, I just copy (dd) to a new microSD and then it's back in service. This brand is no different than any other in that regard, but Kingston's price is reasonable, and you really don't need much space for a single board computer (8GB would be roomy).
customer_reviews.author: Mace Moneta

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price but high quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this on my blackvue dash cam with front and back video. So far I’ve gone a couple months without any issues. Blackvue dash cams typically need a “special” memory card due to constant writing and deleting of video. This memory card has held up perfectly for almost a year now. I also have the blackvue backup battery so my camera is running 24/7 without any problems. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Myles

customer_reviews.title: Unless your camera or the type of work you do requires certain specifics...
customer_reviews.text: these memory cards will work in most SLR and DSLR cameras. Further, cards from different manufacturers that have the same read/write speeds, the same Class, and the same Gigabyte capacity will most always give you similar performance. As a still photographes, I shop for the 3 aforementioned characteristics, then compare the cost per Gb. Buy low!
customer_reviews.author: noneedtoknow

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 of these to use on a trip. They arrived the day before I left so I just packed them thinking they would work in our computers and cameras since they were a name brand. Big mistake. They were not recognized in our cameras and the computers took forever to read them and when they did they could not format them. These are total junk.
customer_reviews.author: Slickwilly

customer_reviews.title: Good value and reliable
customer_reviews.text: These cards are cheap, reliable, and have decent performance specs, and last time I bought another 3 of them. They provide great price / performance value. I strongly prefer these traditional SDHC cards (rather than micro-SD cards in adapters) - since I have far fewer worries about loose connections and dust/dirt affecting electrical contacts. They arrive in attractive retail packaging but without a protective case.
customer_reviews.author: Photographer James Falkofske

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in my Wyze Security Cameras
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this micro sd card to use in my WYZE products and it does what it is designed to do. It stores video and stills and allows playback without any trouble. It processes rapid transfer of data from card to other electronic devices (pc, text messaging, etc). As I continue to add on security cameras I will purchase more of these cards.
customer_reviews.author: mzgee

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Where can I say? There's not a lot to say about an SD card. I got this for a tablet for my son. I just wanted a little extra storage. So I paid next to nothing & got 32 gigs. The only thing I can say is that my tablet told me the SD card was slow and may affect apps if I transfer apps to it. So this isn't a fast card. However, I am still using it & have seen no issues.
customer_reviews.author: S. McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Card didn’t last. Card failure and so far I haven’t been able to reformat it
customer_reviews.text: Used it for dash cam in my truck. Dash cam manufacturer only endorsed this card and says not to use the most common cards found in stores for reasonable prices. Unfortunately the card failed after 6 months. Card didn’t last. Card failure and so far I haven’t been able to reformat it to try and reuse it. It won’t reformat in dash cam and won’t reformat using a disk tool on my Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kuehl

customer_reviews.title: I’d have to say it’s good if you can get it at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I’m a happy client. Use this in a GoPro hero 7 black and I’ve only had it error out twice in the last 6 months. My SanDisk never does that, but it doesn’t do I often enough to be an issue, and it’s never done it while filming. Only when turning it on, it will say no SD. I turn it off and back on and it’s good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Speed notes: Many products jumbled together in these reviews
customer_reviews.text: I've got three of the 16GB "Canvas Select" cards. Large sequential writes happen at *almost* 10MB/s, measured both with the BlackMagic speed test app, and with dd (writing Raspbian images). Inexpensive Samsung cards manage almost twice this speed. Other reviews here (of larger cards) indicate much better performance than I'm seeing.
customer_reviews.author: olpcuser

customer_reviews.title: Easy peazy
customer_reviews.text: Hassle-free operation. Using this in my Samsung Galaxy S5. Transferred what was stored on my SD card from my previous phone to my computer. Transferred that to this card, put it in my phone, restarted it, and it all appears on my new phone. Couldn't be easier.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: READ THE FINE PRINT
customer_reviews.text: This card works great in my camera, but when I was purchasing it, I needed an SDHC (like it says in the product title). Without reading the description too deeply, I ordered a 64G, knowing I would need quite a bit of space. If you'll observe the very last line of the product description, it says that the SDHC is only for the 32G cards. The rest are SDXC. SDXCs do not work on my audio recorder. I do not know a lot about technology so this may be completely obvious to people more familiar with it than me. Still, great card for devices that can actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Starcher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for short-term dashcams
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for Dashcams. I get 2 and a half days of footage (turning it off at night and turning it on when leaving in morning) No issues at all. **Update 10-31-19, this SD card died out of the blue, assuming from heat since it’s been extremely hot lately. I unfortunately will be choosing another brand to try though as it did not last a year. Neither the Dashcam or a regular PC can detect the card in a readable storage format.**
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: they changed manufacturing on these i think
customer_reviews.text: 1 month ago the cards i ordered were working find with a 32gb raspberry pi image. now they are NOT COMPATIBLE and corrupt every 32gb image i put on them. the samsung ones work fine. do not order if you have a raspberry pi i think the storage is slightly less then other brands by a couple of bytes which leads to 32gb linux images becoming corrupt
customer_reviews.author: susan may

customer_reviews.title: Short lived, bought 12- 5 died in less than 1yr.
customer_reviews.text: I am so done with Kingston. Bought (12) 32 Gb micro SD Cards and I just replaced the 6th one. It's been 13 months since they were installed and the first one quit within 2 weeks after end of warranty. That was in March so six went "toes up" in the last 11 months. And they will probably all be gone in the next few months.
customer_reviews.author: CakeorDeath

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work when I finally decided to use it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this disc in August 2019 for an event (Wedding) scheduled for 31 Dec 19. When I finally opened the packet prior to the wedding and tried to use the disc, it did not work for me. My camera could not recognize the disc and keep reading that I needed to insert a disc, even though the disc was inserted. I thought maybe the disc needed to be formatted, but the disc will not complete formatting. Unfortunately because I did not use the disc before September 2019, the time to return has expired. Very disappointed with this amazon product.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Alston

customer_reviews.title: Does it work?
customer_reviews.text: Bought the kingston 64gb micro sd U1, two of them. Both did the same thing, would randomly show up as not there in my kids kindle, newer model. Switched it with an older sandisk and worked fine... was a class 10, 8gb model, so take that as you please. If I had a ton of extra sd cards around, maybe I could come up with more definitive results, but this one definitely let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: never again
customer_reviews.text: Amazon claims they "delivered" a package to my business at 10:38pm last Saturday night. This is impossible as our business has a security gate that closes at 7pm and an 8-foot barb wire fence around the property. Amazon does not allow customers to file a claim for a missing package! I'll never use them again.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Good Cheap option for a recovery drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive in an attempt to make a recovery USB drive that was cost efficient. This drive worked perfectly in order to make a recovery drive and i had no write/read errors. i definitely recommend these if they can be purchased at a great rate and when transfer speeds are not a priority..this si the drive for you.
customer_reviews.author: veritech_13Top Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my Rexing V1 Gen 3
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (256Gb) exclusively for my Rexing V1 Gen 3 to record at 2160p @ 24fps and it has worked as expected for about 2 months now. I also purchased the 128Gb size for other use. I look forward to getting more of these when i get another Rexing dash cam, this is basically the top recommendation from Rexing.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Constant ERROR in card - Damaged card.
customer_reviews.text: Love Kingston products, until this one... have Kingston memory for decades, and this one came bad from start, it gives constant errors and block my dslr. Format it 5 times to fix the problem, but again it gives error, and you can't rely your work in broken memory card, so to me it's useless now. Last Kingston product i buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastián Zahn

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a patient at my job MP3 player. works great stores music. I could take it out and put it into my laptop download songs in there and put it into her MP3 player or you can leave it in the MP3 player and connect it to my laptop with the USB cord and download
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes woodson

customer_reviews.title: cool helpful
customer_reviews.text: When you insert your card, you should set up the format of the card! That's so cool! I don't know why it doesn't work for the first time. I tried it many times and waist a lot of time~however, the assistant help me solve the problem~ now I can use the 128 huge SD card without worrying the time~very good~
customer_reviews.author: Alma

customer_reviews.title: Fast, cheap and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Love the price for this little space gem. Very good deal for how much Gigs offered. Was super easy to use and quick to transfer files to. Only wish I ordered two at time of purchase since the price is for add ons only.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Maye

customer_reviews.title: what happened?
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 64GB SD card few weeks ago, and today I have time to install my car camera. I inserted it into the camera, and the camera still show please insert the sd card. I tried it on another camera, it showed the memory error... what happened? At beginning, I thought probably my car camera broken, however I inserted the 32 SD card which comes with car camera, it works great.... So the result is the 64GB SD card couldn't be used in my camera .......
customer_reviews.author: Isabella Jin

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for RexingV1P Pro dual car camera
customer_reviews.text: RexingV1P Pro recommended this brand use a smaller card most of the time. My camera just re-record over the recording when the card is full unless I have something saved then it skips over the saved part and keeps it saved. I’ve had no problems with it that I know of, I have not tried to look at the recording yet. I use a 128GB card, same brand when I drive all day.
customer_reviews.author: AVW

customer_reviews.title: Micro Memory SDXC for cell phone
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to install into cell phone. The cell recognized the memory card immediately and was able to create a new Photo, Video, Document storage location. Would recommend this product and the 64GB memory size for your phone. Stop the worry of running out of memory storage for photos and videos.
customer_reviews.author: gary griffith

customer_reviews.title: Good budget card - writes are faster than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Good choice for budget Raspberry Pi projects. When flashing the OS (4GB), wrote at ~17MB/sec. Which is much better than other budget cards that I have used. Certainly there are faster cards, but not for $3.99.
customer_reviews.author: Ross W. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good luck getting it out of the package.
customer_reviews.text: Only one complaint. The packaging of the memory card was in, was like trying to crack open a walnut with only using fingernails. I used several knives and scissors to get the memory card free. Once it was freed, I put it in my new dash cam. Works like a charm! I will be buying a 64 gig model soon.
customer_reviews.author: Having fun!

customer_reviews.title: Helpful in the Roku
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in our Roku 2 so that we don't have to reload channels from time to time. That is a minor inconvenience in the greater scheme of things, but it can still get a little annoying. With this memory card installed, that annoyance is a thing of the past.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy divers

customer_reviews.title: Just What My Old Digital Camera Needed
customer_reviews.text: I had this old Kodak point and shoot digital lying around. It had a 10 shot picture capacity or something like that. I popped in the 32G and bam, 1000 pictures available. Alrighty then. After playing around with the camera I remember why I stopped using it. Not very good photos, but the card installed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: jenesaiquoi

customer_reviews.title: Been Using Kingston since I was a Kid
customer_reviews.text: Great memory at much more affordable price. Bought the 16gb for my tablet and the 64gb for my wife's phone. Both are working flawlessly with easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Leo and Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the taste of these! Although only available when in season, they are getting more rare because of the crackdowns. But I can't wait to serve these to my wife's parents at Christmas! As others have said, they go great with cranberry, nectar, and even vodka! Minus 1 star because not available in the off-season.
customer_reviews.author: RTegland

customer_reviews.title: Go with brand name!
customer_reviews.text: I've used off-brand SD and micro SD cards and gotten burned every time, losing precious and unrecoverable data. With Kingston, I haven't gone wrong. And at $20, it's a very reasonable price point. Been using for over 2 years without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ayah Muted

customer_reviews.title: MicroSDHC Card for Camera
customer_reviews.text: There wasn't anything I dislike, I will be using the Kingston Digital 32GB microSDHC Class 10 UHS-I 80MB/s Read Card with SD Adapter for extra storage on my 35 mm camera for pictures and videos of our upcoming trip. Good quality and amazing price!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Foster

customer_reviews.title: Took a long time to receive
customer_reviews.text: For some odd reason, I received this order almost 6 months later. Since I couldn't recall whether I received it and thought that if I did receive it, I must have misplaced it, so I chocked it up to a loss. Other than that the cards worked well.
customer_reviews.author: K. Munn

customer_reviews.title: Did weird stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my phone. Moving apps to it was slow and it got hung up in process. Very frustrating. After I moved apps to this SD card, phone had LESS internal storage. The my phone function ran very slowly. I removed it and threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: In Minn

customer_reviews.title: It does it’s job dutifully
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my new Switch. I have bought a lot of things from Kingston over the years, and I have not been disappointed yet. This has tripled the storage space and for a very impressive price, so I’ll definitely be a Kingston customer for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Extant Novartis

product_meta.title: Kingston Canvas Go! 64GB microSDXC Class 10 microSD Memory Card UHS-I 90MB/s R Flash Memory Card with Adapter (SDCG2/64GB)
product_meta.description: Style:Canvas Go| Pattern Name:microSD Card| Size:64GBKingston's Canvas Go! microSD card is designed to be on-the-go, making it ideal for filming life's adventures in 1080p or even 4K. You can be confident that your memories will be safe when documenting the next journey on your GoPro, drone, or dash cam. It's available in multiple capacities up to 128GB1, to provide plenty of space to capture an entire trip. Kingston Canvas cards are tested to be durable, so you can take them anywhere with confidence that your photos, videos, and other data will be protected, even in harsh or unstable conditions.
feature_bullets: Ideal for Class 10 UHS I U3 speeds up to 90 MB/s read: 45 MB/s writer action cameras: drones and dash cameras
Class 10 UHS I U3 speeds up to 90 MB/s read; 45 MB/s write

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars33,061 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
